title: 113_s1357
content: The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2013 extends the Trade Adjustment Assistance Program. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2013 extends provisions related to termination, training funds, reemployment assistance, and authorizations of appropriations until 2020. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2013 extends provisions for trade adjustment assistance for firms and farmers until 2020. Amendments are made to the Trade Act of 1974 to reflect this extension. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2013 extends provisions for trade adjustment assistance until 2021, with amendments made to the Trade Act of 1974. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2013 extends provisions for trade adjustment assistance until 2021, with amendments made to the Trade Act of 1974. Sections 256(b), 298(a), and 285 of the Act are modified to apply from January 1, 2021, replacing previous fiscal years. Assistance under chapter 3 and chapter 6 may not be provided after December 31, 2021, except for previously approved assistance if funds are available and the recipient is eligible. Assistance under chapter 6 may be provided before December 31, 2021, if funds are available and the recipient is eligible. Section 233(b) of the Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2011 is amended to extend benefits until 2021.
